availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Alfred Ellet (U.S. Army lieutenant colonel)

body.p: U.S. Army lieutenant colonel. Illinois native. Son of John I. Ellet and Sarah Jane Ellet. School teacher in San Mateo County, California, in 1860. Served in the Mississippi Marine Brigade (U.S.A.) as lieutenant colonel from November 1862, to August 1864. Commander of the ram ship USS Lancaster until its destruction on March 25, 1863. Served as commander of the Mississippi Marine Brigade's ram fleet from August 14, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, California, San Mateo County, Belmont, Township 1, p. 70.
"The Wichita Daily Eagle, 1892-04-14," Chronicling America: Historic American Newspapers, Library of Congress, https://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn82014635/1892-04-14/ed-1/seq-4/ (accessed on January 4, 2021).
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Colorado, Application #555534, Certificate #397746.
Indexes to the Carded Records of Soldiers Who Served in Volunteer Organizations During the Civil War, compiled 1899 - 1927, documenting the period 1861 - 1866, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M1290, Roll 0033.
Warren Daniel Crandall and Isaac Denison Newell, eds., History of the Ram Fleet and the Mississippi Marine Brigade in the War for the Union on the Mississippi and Its Tributaries (St. Louis, MO: Press of Buschart Brothers, 1907), 5, 206.
Find A Grave, "LTC John Alfred Ellet (1838-1892)," Memorial #49998501, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49998501 (accessed January 4, 2021).
